alert.note: Alert for Ottawa (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 19 at 3:02PM EST until February 20 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: .An ice jam may cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Michigan, including the following county, Ottawa. This includes the Grand River in the vicinity of Robinson Township and Eastmanville. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Localized flooding of low lying areas and property along the Grand River may occur upstream and downstream of the ice jam. Rapid water level fluctuations may occur due to heavy ice cover on the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Based on river gages and county official observations, an ice jam exists on the Grand River between Robinson Township and Eastmanville. Water levels were fluctuating in this region. A report from a county official in the Eastmanville area indicated large sheets of ice were present there. At this time no flooding was known, however given the unstable ice situation present, an increased risk for flooding exists in this region of the Grand River. Close monitoring of the situation will be needed until the ice clears. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
